_header: These worldly joys that fair in sight appears
_description: On the temptacions of the world — six lines

HunEL26C9.Transcription:
thes worldly ioies, that faier in sight apearesarr Lvring baits
                    whereto oure minds we castthrise blessed they that have repenting
                    yearesTo hate their sinns, and leve their follies pastMy inward mane
                    to hevenly things wold trade meBut aye this flesh doth still and still
                    disswade me
HunEL26C9.Note:
Added by a sixteenth-century hand; signed, ‘RN’ (=Roger Lord
                    North, d. 1600)
HunEL26C9.Facsimiles:
Woodward,  Daniel,  and  Martin Stevens, eds.  
             The New Ellesmere Chaucer Facsimile (Huntington MS EL 26 C 9).
         Tokyo: Yushodo, and San Marino, CA: Huntington Library, 1995.
